docs.title: File naming
docs.text:
Spaces by hyphens (-) Reason: for better readability, as well as ease of insertion, plus search engines interpret hyphens as spaces Example: Bangalore-Metro-Map.pdf

Filenames need to be short, descriptive, in title case, and not only numbers like an id. But they can and ideally should end with the id. So tldr: id+descriptive seperated by hyphens Reason: So they can be searched in finder also and return usable results Example: The-Epochalypse-in-Year-2038-241203112712

docs.title: Attachments
docs.text:
tldr: each and every attachment must have a the unique id of the associated container file in its filename like a regular md file.

Container file: It would be desirable for each such attachment to have an associated md file in markdown that links to that attachment with descriptive content about the attachment. The filename should be the same file name as the attachment but obviously the extension would be markdown. So both the container file and the attachment can be searched for with the same id number and also will be listed sequentially in ordered lists. E.g: 20260123110759-Bangalore-city-map.md references the attachment: 20260123110759-Bangalore-city-map.pdf

So first create the .md file, copy the Zid and then rename the attachment. The .md file will have a desctiptive tile, desciptive name, and descriptive content but must include the Zid to be referencable.

docs.title: Tags
docs.text: Tags if they have multiple words need to seperated by hyphens and use lowercase e.g: #metro-map

docs.title: Unique ids
docs.text: Unique ids follow this format: z#: 251230104002 Generated by: "z#: %y%M%D%h%m%s" Zettlr pattern detection: (\d{12}) (Any sequence of 12 or more digits will be recognized)

docs.title: Zettelkasten Folder
docs.text: Do not specify a path to the Zettelkasten folder as though it makes creating new files through links, it makes managing them difficult especially while deleting. You may end up creating a new file through a spelling mistake and then you have to end up deleting them.

docs.title: Basic Chess Principles
docs.text:
1. Control the Center "Who controls the center, controls the game"
  2. King Safety Castle early, and don't rush to attack if your King isn't safe.
  3. Piece Development Complete development before attacking. Knights before bishops, Connect Rooks
  4. Piece Co-ordination Maintain communication between pieces
  5. Pawn structures Avoid isolated or doubled pawns
  6. Initiative and Tempo Keep opponent reacting and make forcing moves
  7. Material Balance Know piece values (P=1, N/B=3, R=5, Q=9)
  8. Tactical Awareness Always check for forcing moves, pins, forks, and skewers
  9. Strategic planning Formulate long-term plans, identifying and targeting weaknesses

  10. Endgame fundamentals King activity is crucial

  11. Control the Center "Who controls the center, controls the game"

docs.title: Eating Raw Oats
docs.text:
Oatmeal can be eaten without cooking, as raw oats are safe to consume after processing. They can be enjoyed in recipes like overnight oats or smoothies.

They can be soaked in water or milk overnight for easier digestibility. Simply add equal parts oats and a liquid such as milk to a mason jar, give it a stir or shake, pop it in the fridge and enjoy it the next morning.

docs.title: Avalahalli Forest
docs.text: Not to be confused with the one near Yelahanka, this Avalahalli near Kithaganur is untamed. Red mud trails crisscross with old gravel paths. Ideal for long, contemplative walks or mindful photography. It's not a trek. It's a dialogue, with nature and yourself.

docs.title: Cliches About Change
docs.text:
A leopard can’t change its spots – People rarely change their true nature.

All good things must come to an end – Nothing lasts forever.\

Change is in the air – A shift or transformation is about to happen.\

Change is the only constant – Life is always moving forward.\

History repeats itself – Events tend to recur in cycles.\

Old habits die hard – It’s difficult to stop ingrained behaviors.\

Out with the old, in with the new – Replace old ways with new ones.\

The more things change, the more they stay the same – Surface changes often don’t alter fundamentals.\

Turn over a new leaf – Start fresh with new habits.\

When one door closes, another opens – Fresh opportunities arise after setbacks.

docs.title: Create a static website on Github Pages
docs.text:
We already have our access token, so this will allow Publii to access our Github Page to upload the website files, but now we have to actually create the area on Github where our site will go. Let's go back to Github and get started:

  1. Log-in to Github as normal, then click the plus icon in the topbar to open a submenu; now click on the New repository option to be taken to the Create a new repository screen. 

  2. On this screen, fill out a Repository name, and leave the repository as Public (Github Pages are always public, even when the repository hosting it is made private). Next, click the green Create repository button at the bottom of the screen. 

### Simplify your website URL to yourusername.github.io

By default your Github page URL will be username.github.io/repository-name, but we can simplify this by creating a repository for our website called yourusername.github.io e.g. if my username is TestName, I would create a repository called TestName.github.io.

Then, instead of duplicating the URL as TestName.github.io/TestName, Github will simplify the URL to TestName.github.io only.

  1. Now we're on the Quick setup screen; this might seem a little confusing, but we only need to do one simple thing here. Click on the README link as shown in the pic below; this will take us to a screen for creating a readme file. 

  2. On the edit screen for the readme, just click the Commit new file button. We're only creating this file because your repository needs at least one item to be added to create your master branch, where all your Publii files will go. This created file will be removed automatically the first time Publii is syned with our Github Page. 

  3. After committing the file we're taken back to the file listing; click on the Settings tab near the top of the screen. 

  4. On the settings screen, in the left-sidebar, click on the Pages; in the Build and deployment section, specifically in the Branch section, click on the drop-down list that by default displays None, and select main branch from the list of options. Now click the Save button to make sure the changes are committed. 

  5. After saving, your GitHub pages will be ready to be used as a static website host; to view your website you'll need to go to the URL provided in the message box. Sometimes you may need to refresh the page you are currently viewing to see the URL box. Of course, your site doesn't have any files yet, but we're going to change that. 

And that's it for the Github side of things; Now go to github desktop

docs.title: The delete command
docs.text:
Sentence: The s (sentence) only works with a modifier i or a. So das (delete around sentence) will ax the entire sentence including trailing space, and dis (delete inside sentence) will delete everything up to and including the period, but will leave the trailing space intact.

Blocks: The b key wkas unclear - it works on "parenthetical blocks". So you need to haves something like this:

Bla bla bla, (some shit in parens) bla bla.

So you go f( to put cursor on the parens, then hit dib to turn it into () or dab to delete the entire thing in one go.

Lines: dd to delete an entire line.

docs.title: terminal #grep
docs.text:
To find a word or pattern in a file, use the basic grep syntax:

  • grep "string of text" filename

  • This command returns the full text of each line containing the text string you entered.

  • If you only want to see the matching words or strings, add the -o option.

-i option to ignore case

If you only want to see a result if it's a word on its own—not within a longer word—use the -w option.

If you want to know how many times certain text appears in a file, use the -c option.

To find lines that contain two specific words or patterns, you can use the pipe symbol to perform a second grep command. For example, let's say you want to find all lines that contain the words "wikiHow" and "Google:"

  • grep -i "wikiHow" filename.txt | grep -i "Google"

Another way to do this is by using regular expressions and the -E option * grep -E "wikiHow.*Google|Google.*wikiHow" filename.txt OR

grep -E 'wikiHow|Google' filename.txt

To search for a word across multiple files in the terminal, you can use the grep command with the -r option for recursive searching. For example, use grep -r "search_word" /path/to/directory/ to find "search_word" in all files within the specified directory and its subdirectories.

to find all instances of the word "wikiHow" in your Python files, but not in other files in a directory.  grep wikiHow *.py

to know the name of each file containing a certain word or series of characters, use the -l option.

grep -l "string of text" /home/myusername

```

  • The grep command is case-sensitive, but you can use grep -i to ignore case.

LC_ALL=C find /media/username -name '*.lua' -type f

docs.title: How to change iphone HEIF camera settings
How to change iphone HEIF camera settings
iphone #images #camera #heif
docs.text: To change your iPhone's HEIF settings, go to Settings > Camera > Formats, and select "Most Compatible" to capture photos in JPEG format instead of HEIF. This will ensure that new photos are saved in a more widely compatible format.

docs.title: How to convert HEIF images on Mac
How to convert HEIF images on Mac
mac #images #HEIF
docs.text:
Using Preview on Mac:

  • Open the HEIF file in Preview.
  • Go to "File" > "Export" and select the desired format.

To batch convert HEIF files to JPEG on a Mac, you can use the Preview app by selecting all the HEIF images, then going to File > Export Selected Images, and choosing JPEG as the format. Alternatively, you can use the Finder's Quick Actions feature by selecting the images, right-clicking, and choosing "Convert Image" to convert them all at once.

See also: [[260106111752|What is the HEIF file format]]

docs.title: How to convert markdown to HTML

markdown #html #ssg
docs.text:
https://wethat.github.io/MarkdownToHtml/ This one requires PowerShell from Microsoft which is easy enough to install on Mac but then running the build also requires a Windows Virtual machine > So UNusable because of too much hassles

md2blog > This is the most promising but creates files with a dark background https://jaredkrinke.github.io/md2blog/

blag https://github.com/venthur/blag Wasn't able to install using pip (some issue on my mac)

bashblog Requires server access

bashwrite Requires server access

blogC++ Tried experiments to compile but couldn't

BBSG Easy to install and start with git and docs But dependencies need to be installed

markdown-to-folder https://github.com/joakin/markdown-folder-to-html?tab=readme-ov-file It just works!

md2blog > This is the most promising but creates files with a dark background https://jaredkrinke.github.io/md2blog/

docmd needs node and npm doesnt work on my machine

okidoki Works well locally but not easily deployable

Gaiden Outputs html files, but no search

Pagegen Deplyment will be a challenge

SiteGen https://github.com/RC-Lee/SiteGen?tab=readme-ov-file It works like markdown-to-folder, but not as well (doesn't convert .md links to .html links automatically; also the index page layout is very basic and doesnt show any folder structure)

daux.io is promising but is not

VS COde to batch export? https://deepwiki.com/yzhang-gh/vscode-markdown/3.2-markdown-to-html-export (Alongwith the Cline Helper and File Tree Generation extensions)

docs.title: terminal #navigation
docs.text:
• The ~ shows where you are in the file system of the Mac. ~ is a shortcut that means the current user’s Home folder. (In the Finder, that’s the folder with your user name and the house icon.)

  • Tip: If you type cd and press the Return key—with no directory specified—you’ll go back to your Home folder. (You can also type cd ~ to go there.)

  • If you type cd /, you’ll go to the root level of your startup disk.

  • If you type cd .. (that’s two periods), you’ll go to the directory above the one you’re currently in. So if you’re in your home folder, and type cd .., you’ll go to your Mac’s /Users folder.

  • And if you type cd - (hyphen) you’ll go back to the directory you were in before the last time you issued the cd command

  • The % is a character that the shell (the default interface that Terminal uses) displays to indicate that it’s ready to accept a command.

  • Type pwd in the terminal and press Enter. pwd stands for “print working directory”. The output from this command tells you which folder is your current working directory.

  • Next, you can explore the contents of the working directory. Type ls into your terminal and press Enter. ls stands for “list”.

  • The % is a character that the shell (the default interface that Terminal uses) displays to indicate that it’s ready to accept a command.

docs.title: amazon
docs.text:
To contact Amazon customer service, 

1. Click the Hello, Mohan (Accounts & Lists) button on the top right of your screen (I'm using a laptop, it may be different on a mobile)

2. Scroll down & click the Contact Us button on the page that opens

3. You can try the chat option to resolve your issue or else click the Have us call you/Call me button

4. If you select the Have us call you option, select the order you have an issue with 

5. Specify what kind of issue you're facing

6. Select what language you would want the agent to speak with you in:

and then click the Phone button. 

7. Type in the number at which you want to be called on and they will call you back, showing you a live status update on the time within which they will call you back (typically 1-2 min)

docs.title: How to dry soaked nuts
docs.text: Once you’ve soaked your nuts, you may wonder how to dry nuts after soaking. Drying is important to prevent mold growth and ensure the nuts stay fresh. You can either air-dry them or use a dehydrator or oven.

docs.title: - Air-drying:
docs.text: Spread the nuts on a clean towel and let them sit at room temperature until fully dry.

docs.title: - Oven:
docs.text: If you’re in a hurry, set your oven to the lowest temperature (around 150°F or 65°C) and spread the nuts on a baking sheet. Dry for a few hours, stirring occasionally.

docs.title: - Dehydrator:
docs.text:
Use a dehydrator at 115°F (46°C) for 12–24 hours, depending on the type of nut.

This process, called soaking and dehydrating nuts, helps you enjoy the best of both worlds including improved digestibility and the crunchy texture of nuts.

docs.title: How to run an executable in mac
How to run an executable in mac
mac #executable #chmod #terminal
docs.text:
To run an executable in mac

1). Move to the path of the file:

cd/PATH_OF_THE_FILE

2). Run the following command to set the file's executable bit using the chmod command:

chmod +x ./NAME_OF_THE_FILE

3). Run the following command to execute the file:

./NAME_OF_THE_FILE

Once you have run these commands, going ahead you just have to run command 3, while in the files path.

Ref: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15080835/running-an-executable-in-mac-terminal

docs.title: How to run an executable in path on mac
How to run an executable in PATH
mac #executable #chmod
docs.text:
Unix will only run commands if they are available on the system path, as you can view by the $PATH variable

echo $PATH

Executables located in directories that are not on the path cannot be run unless you specify their full location. So in your case, assuming the executable is in the current directory you are working with, then you can execute it as such

./my-exec

Where my-exec is the name of your program.

Ref: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15080835/running-an-executable-in-mac-terminal

docs.title: How to set Finder Default view
How to set the default Finder view
mac #Finder
docs.text:
NOTE: This is the one that ultimately worked: https://macpaw.com/how-to/remove-ds-store-files-on-mac

(Make sure to do the above after switching to the main directory in which all your other folders are kept.) Imp steps below: Deleting .DS_Store files manually If you want to go down the manual route and delete .DS_Store files individually, you can do this using the Terminal:

Go to Applications > Utilities > Terminal. Locate the folder or directory that you want to remove the .DS_Store file from. Type cd into the Terminal followed by your folder path, so it looks something like this: cd /Users/username/nameoffolder Press Return. Type find . -name ‘.DS_Store’ -type f -delete Press Return again.

Delete all .DS_Store files on your computer Chances are you’ve opened some Finder windows in the past. Individual folder options will override this default setting that we just set.

In order reset your folder settings across the entire machine we have to delete all .DS_Store files. This will ensure that all folders start fresh. Open up the Terminal application (Applications/Utilities/Terminal), and type:

sudo find / -name .DS_Store -delete; killall Finder You will then be prompted for your password. You won’t see your password as you type, so type carefully. This may take a minute or two because it’s going to search your entire computer for .DS_Store files.

docs.title: layout

  • Type: String that matches the name of the layout. For a layout named components/landing, the value would be product-landing.
  • Optional. If omitted, DefaultLayout is used.

docs.title: Info on Walnuts
docs.text:
Walnuts are creamy, slightly bitter nuts that can be eaten raw as they are, or toasted to bring out more of their flavour: place the nuts on a baking sheet in a single layer and bake on a medium heat for 10-12 mins. 

Unshelled walnuts should be stored in an airtight container in a cool, dark place - they'll last for around three months. Shelled walnuts should be kept in an airtight container in the fridge - they'll last for up to six months.

References: BBC Good food guide, 2025: https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/glossary/walnut-glossary

docs.title: watches #clocks
docs.text:
Austrian engineer Josef Pallweber is widely credited for having patented the jumping hours mechanism in pocket watches in 1883

Instead of the gradual sweeping motion of two hands on the dial, watches with jumping hours have numerals ‘jump’ to the next digit at the end of the 59th minute.

Examples: - A. Lange & Söhne’s Zeitwerk - Chronoswiss Delphis - Gerald Charles Maestro 4.0 Ducati 30° Anniversario 916

markdown #coding

docs.title: The Debate on Roasting Raw Peanuts
docs.text:
Do you need to soak raw peanuts before roasting them?

Raw peanuts, also known as green peanuts, are unprocessed and offer a blank canvas for culinary creativity. They are nutrient-dense, rich in protein, healthy fats, vitamins, and minerals.

However, preparing raw peanuts for roasting requires an understanding of their properties and how different methods can affect their final flavor, texture, and nutritional qualities.

What Happens When You Soak Peanuts? Soaking peanuts involves submerging them in water for a certain period before cooking. The primary effects include:

Hydration: Soaking allows the peanuts to absorb water, leading to a lighter texture during roasting. Flavor Enhancement: Soaking can sometimes enhance the flavor profile, especially if seasonings or brines are added to the water. Soaking time can vary, ranging from a few hours to overnight. The longer peanuts soak, the more moisture they absorb, which can lead to a softer texture.

Benefits of Soaking Peanuts Improved Texture: Soaking can soften the peanuts, making them less likely to become overly hard when roasted. This can be particularly appealing for those who prefer peanuts with a more tender bite.

Better Flavor Absorption: Soaking peanuts in water mixed with salt or spices can infuse them with additional flavors. This technique can elevate a simple snack into a gourmet treat.

Nutritional Benefits: Soaking can help to reduce some anti-nutrients like phytic acid, which may enhance the bioavailability of certain minerals.

Drawbacks of Soaking Peanuts However, soaking does come with some considerations:

Time-Consuming: Soaking raw peanuts requires planning ahead. If you need a quick snack, this method may not be suitable.

Potential Over-Saturation: If soaked for too long, peanuts may absorb excessive moisture, leading to steaming rather than roasting. This can result in a less desirable texture and flavor.

Variability in Cooking Time: Soaked peanuts may require adjustments in roasting time, making it a bit trickier for those unfamiliar with the process.

Roasting Peanuts: The Process If you decide not to soak your raw peanuts, roasting them is a fairly straightforward process.

  1. Preheat Your Oven Preheat your oven to approximately 350°F (175°C). This moderate temperature allows for even roasting without burning the peanuts.

  2. Prepare the Peanuts If you choose the unsoaked route, simply rinse your raw peanuts under cold water to remove any dirt or debris. This step ensures that both soaked and unsoaked peanuts are clean before cooking.

  3. Spread on a Baking Sheet Arrange the cleaned peanuts in a single layer on a baking sheet. Avoid overcrowding; this promotes even cooking.

  4. Roast to Perfection Roast the peanuts for 20 to 30 minutes, stirring occasionally to ensure even browning. Pay close attention to the fragrance and color of the peanuts; they should turn a golden brown and develop a rich, nutty aroma.

  5. Cool and Season After roasting, remove the peanuts from the oven and allow them to cool completely before seasoning. This step allows them to reach their full crunchiness.

Do You Need to Soak Raw Peanuts Before Roasting? A Personal Choice Ultimately, the decision to soak raw peanuts before roasting comes down to personal preference. Here are some guiding questions to help you decide:

Consider Your Texture Preference If you enjoy a softer, crunchier peanut, soaking might be the way to go. For those who prefer firm, crunchy peanuts, roasting them straight away will likely yield a more satisfying result.

Do You Have Time to Soak? Assess your time: if you can manage the soaking process, why not give it a try for a unique snacking experience? If you’re in a hurry, roasting unsoaked peanuts is a quick and effective alternative.

Flavor Considerations Think about the flavors you want to incorporate. Soaking allows for the addition of spices or salt which can elevate the final product. If you prefer plain peanuts, roasting unsoaked ones may suffice.

Alternative Methods and Tips for Roasting Peanuts Whether you soak your peanuts or not, there are various tips and tricks to enhance your roasting experience.

  1. Stovetop Roasting For those without an oven, peanuts can also be roasted on the stovetop. Use a heavy skillet, and heat it over medium heat. Add the peanuts and roast them while stirring frequently until they become golden brown.

  2. Microwave Roasting If you’re looking for a quick fix, peanuts can be roasted in the microwave as well. Spread them in a single layer on a microwave-safe plate, cover with a paper towel, and cook in short bursts, stirring between intervals until roasted.

  3. Adding Flavors Experiment with seasoning after roasting. Toss your peanuts with melted butter and spices or sugar to create a sweet or savory treat.

Common Flavors for Roasted Peanuts To spice up your roasted peanuts, consider the following flavorful options:

Flavoring Description Salt The classic choice for a savory snack. Garlic Powder Adds a robust flavor for savory lovers. Cinnamon and Sugar A sweet option for dessert-style peanuts. Chili Powder Perfect for a spicy kick. Conclusion: The Choice is Yours In conclusion, the question of whether to soak raw peanuts before roasting hinges on personal preference, desired texture, and flavor. Both methods yield delicious results that can elevate your snacking experience. If you find joy in experimenting, why not try both techniques? You might discover that soaking and roasting provides a unique flavor burst unique to your palate.

Enjoy your peanut roasting journey! Whether you choose to soak or roast raw peanuts straight away, the end result is bound to be a delightful and crunchy addition to your kitchen. Happy roasting!

docs.title: Soaking Seeds
docs.text:
Raw nuts, seeds, and grains contain phytic acid and enzyme inhibitors. These slow digestion and block mineral absorption. Soaking activates enzymes, reduces antinutrients, and partially “pre-digests” the food.

Chia seeds Soak: 20-30 minutes (or overnight) Why: Absorbs water, forms gel, prevents gut irritation Ratio: 1 tbsp seeds + ½ cup water

Flaxseeds Soak: 20-30 minutes (or grind fresh) Why: Improves fibre usability Note: Whole flax passes undigested if not soaked or ground

Pumpkin & sunflower seeds Soak: 4-6 hours Why: Improves protein and mineral absorption Tip: Lightly roast after soaking for better taste

Sesame seeds (til) Soak: 4-6 hours Why: Reduces bitterness, improves calcium absorption Best used: In chutneys, laddoos, pastes

Grains & dals: soaking matters the most here Rice (white or brown) Soak: 30 minutes to 2 hours Why: Easier digestion, fluffier texture Brown rice benefits more from soaking

Oats (whole or rolled) Soak: 6-8 hours Why: Reduces heaviness and bloating Tip: Add warm water or curd

Quinoa Soak: 6-8 hours Why: Removes saponins that cause bitterness Always rinse well after soaking

Moong dal (split or whole) Soak: 4-6 hours Why: Improves digestibility Good for: Cheelas, khichdi, sprouts

Chickpeas (chana) Soak: 8-12 hours Why: Reduces gas and cooking time Always pressure-cook after soaking

Rajma Soak: 10-12 hours Why: Heavy legume; soaking is non-negotiable Discard soaking water before cooking

Common soaking mistakes to avoid • Soaking in hot water (kills enzymes) • Soaking too long without changing water • Not rinsing after soaking • Eating soaked nuts after days in the fridge • Assuming soaking replaces proper cooking Soaking improves digestion; it doesn’t make raw food instantly digestible.

docs.title: Soaking Nuts
docs.text:
Nuts, seeds, and grains naturally contain compounds that protect them in nature but stress digestion in humans. Nuts have natural compounds that protect them from sprouting prematurely. While these compounds are helpful for the nut, they can interfere with nutrient absorption in the human body.

Soaking softens these defences, making nutrients easier to absorb and meals easier to tolerate. The trick is timing. Too little soaking does almost nothing. Too much can ruin texture and taste. Soaked nuts are easier to digest than raw ones because the soaking process starts breaking down the complex fats and proteins, making them gentler on the stomach.

Raw nuts, seeds, and grains contain phytic acid and enzyme inhibitors. These slow digestion and block mineral absorption. Soaking activates enzymes, reduces antinutrients, and partially “pre-digests” the food.

Almonds 8–12 hours Improves calcium absorption

Cashews 2–4 hours Creamier texture and easier digestion

Walnuts 6–8 hours Enhanced omega-3 fatty acid availability

Hazelnut 8–12 hours Increased nutrient absorption

Pecans 4–6 hours Better digestion and flavor enhancement

Almonds: Soak: 8-12 hours (overnight) Why: Removes bitterness, softens skin, improves mineral absorption How to use: Peel skin after soaking for best digestion

Walnuts Soak: 4-6 hours Why: Reduces tannins that can cause heaviness Tip: Don’t over-soak; they turn bitter

Cashews

Soak: 2-4 hours Why: Already soft; short soaking improves digestion Good for: Pastes, gravies, smoothies

Peanuts Soak: 6-8 hours Why: Reduces gas-causing compounds Tip: Always cook after soaking

docs.title: Thattekere Lake
docs.text: Just 40 km from the city, Thattekere becomes surreal during monsoon. The water rises. The sky drops. And somewhere in between, you stand still. Ideal for cycling, birdwatching, or just doing absolutely nothing. Expect painted storks, kingfishers, and fog rolling over eucalyptus.

docs.title: The Epochalypse in 2038
docs.text: The year 2038 problem (also known as Y2038,Y2K38, Y2K38 superbug, or the Epochalypse is a time computing problem that leaves some computer systems unable to represent times after 03:14:07 UTC on 19 January 2038.

docs.title: dystopia #time #computing
docs.text: See also [[251230102856|Unix-Time-Stamp]]

1. [[251230102811|Avalahalli Forest]]
  2. [[251230102849|Turahalli Forest]]

docs.title: Turahalli Forest
docs.text:
The Last Surviving Forest Within Bangalore City Limits Located just off Kanakapura Road, this deciduous forest becomes a dreamscape during rains. No entry fees. No curated signs. Just rock, tree, and time. [[Avalahalli Forest|Avalahalli Forest]]

Early morning visits offer a soundtrack of peacocks and parakeets. Trek to the hilltop Shiva temple as mist rolls off granite boulders. Bring a flask. There are no shops here. Just solitude. In a city that's always talking, Turahalli listens.

tags: #travel #bangalore

docs.title: What is Unix Timestamp?
docs.text:
A Unix timestamp (also known as Unix time, POSIX time, or Epoch time) is a system for tracking time as a single number. It represents the number of seconds that have elapsed since 00:00:00 UTC on January 1, 1970, excluding leap seconds. This moment in time is called the Unix epoch.

For example, the Unix timestamp 1704067200 represents January 1, 2024, 00:00:00 UTC

docs.title: Use a mac as a usb
How to use a mac as a USB
docs.text:
Target Disk Mode allows you to boot one MacBook as an external hard drive, directly connecting it to another MacBook for file transfer. This method provides the fastest possible transfer speeds, especially when using Thunderbolt connectivity.

Process:

  1. Enable Target Disk Mode: Boot the old MacBook into Target Disk Mode by holding down the ‘T’ key during startup until the Thunderbolt or USB-C icon appears on the screen.

  2. Connect MacBooks: Connect the two MacBooks using a Thunderbolt or USB-C cable.

  3. Mount Disk: The old MacBook’s hard drive will appear as an external disk on the new MacBook.

  4. File Transfer: Drag and drop files between the two machines using Finder.

docs.title: mac #finder #DS_Store
docs.text:
1. Go to ‘Finder’ and locate the folder in which your hidden files are located. If not sure, open any folder with files in it, when you unhide files all hidden files are shown.

  2. Press Cmd + Shift + . [dot] from your keyboard. This will show all the hidden files on your Mac.

Note: Finder.app is programmed to keep .DS_Store files hidden even when using the Command + Shift + . keyboard shortcut to toggle display of hidden files.

Since they are not user managed files and are intended to be used internally by Finder, they are not treated like other hidden files and kept hidden despite using the said shortcut.

docs.title: watches #clocks
docs.text: To read the time on a wandering hours watch you need to know that the minute hand itself displays the hour — but that explanation probably needs a little unpacking: In its most common form, a zero-to-sixty scale occupies a third of the dial and the current hour displayed as a number travels along it, pointing to the current minute.

docs.title: What are smoothies
docs.text:
Smoothies are essentially just a blended mixture of fruits, vegetables, liquid, and sometimes other ingredients such as nuts, seeds, oats, yogurt, and ice.

They are quick to prepare and a convenient way to increase the fruits and vegetables eaten every day. The bitter taste of some vegetables can be masked by the natural sweetness of fruits.

The health of a smoothie depends on its ingredients. Some smoothies are healthy because of their fiber content because unlike fruit juices which are extractions, nothing is lost by blending. However, other smoothies can increase your blood sugar depending on the ingredients. So use water, green tea, or unsweetened oat milk or almond mil as the liquid base. Include fibers (whole fruits, veggies), healthy fats, natural proteins (nuts, Chia seeds).

A danger with smoothies is going overboard with ingredients. Could you eat all the ingredients in one sitting. Then blend it and drink it up without guilt that you've overdosed on calories.

The nutritional profile of a freshly made smoothie is largely comparable to its whole ingredients, and blending is far less destructive to vitamins than methods like boiling. Blending breaks down the rigid cellulose walls of plant cells, which is the primary structural difference between a smoothie and a whole vegetable. This mechanical breakdown essentially pre-digests the food, making the nutrients inside more immediately available for absorption in the human body. The exposure of chopped plant matter to air and the friction from high-speed blades can lead to minor oxidation losses, particularly for heat- and light-sensitive vitamins like Vitamin C. This loss is generally not significant, especially if the smoothie is consumed immediately. The nutritional profile of a freshly made smoothie is largely comparable to its whole ingredients, and blending is far less destructive to vitamins than methods like boiling.

However, The most significant distinction between a smoothie and a whole vegetable lies in the physical structure of the fiber, which dramatically influences digestion and feelings of fullness. When a vegetable is eaten whole, its fiber remains intact, demanding significant chewing and slowing the rate at which the stomach empties its contents. This intact fiber acts like a physical barrier or net, regulating the release of natural sugars and other nutrients into the bloodstream, which leads to a more gradual and sustained blood glucose response.

When vegetables are pulverized in a blender, the fiber is retained—it is not lost as it is in juicing—but its structure is fundamentally altered. The large, net-like fiber particles are reduced to a much smaller particle size. This pulverized fiber loses much of its ability to physically slow down the digestive process. This reduced structure means the liquid meal is consumed faster and leaves the stomach more quickly, resulting in lower satiety and a less sustained feeling of fullness compared to chewing a solid meal.

Smoothies are an excellent tool for maximizing nutrient density, allowing for the quick, convenient consumption of a larger volume of produce than most people would eat in a single sitting. They are particularly useful for individuals with temporary chewing difficulties, poor appetite, or high nutritional requirements, such as athletes or those recovering from illness.

However, this “pre-digestion” can also have drawbacks.The type of fiber also matters. Whole vegetables contain both soluble and insoluble fiber. Soluble fiber dissolves in water, forming a gel-like substance that helps regulate blood sugar and lower cholesterol. Insoluble fiber adds bulk to the stool, promoting healthy bowel movements. Blending can alter the ratio and effectiveness of these fiber types. The rapid influx of nutrients into the bloodstream can lead to a quicker spike in blood sugar, especially if the smoothie contains fruits or sweeteners. Furthermore, the absence of chewing can affect satiety signals, potentially leading to overconsumption. So, conversely, whole vegetables are a better choice for weight management and long-term digestive health due to their superior satiety and effect on blood sugar regulation.Smoothies, being liquid, bypass this chewing process. While they may provide nutrients, they may not trigger the same satiety signals as whole vegetables. This can lead to consuming more calories overall, as you may feel hungry again sooner. Chewing solid vegetables promotes better dental health and encourages the release of digestive enzymes in the mouth, initiating the digestive process more naturally. For those focused on maintaining steady blood sugar levels or reducing overall caloric intake, the intact fiber structure of whole vegetables provides a more beneficial physiological response.

To minimize nutrient loss during smoothie preparation, it’s best to use fresh, high-quality ingredients, blend for the shortest time possible, and consume the smoothie immediately after making it. Adding a source of antioxidants, such as berries, can also help protect against oxidation.

Whenever possible, prioritize eating whole vegetables. Whole vegetables offer superior fiber content, satiety benefits, and potentially better nutrient absorption in the long run.

docs.title: cliche #what-is
docs.text:
The word cliché comes from French. In the 19th century, printers used metal plates called “stereotypes” to reproduce text or images. When hot metal hit the mold, it made a clicking sound — “cliché” in French.

Over time, the word shifted to mean a phrase or idea that was “stamped out” repeatedly until it became overused.

docs.title: What is the HEIF file format
What is the HEIF file format?
iphone #mac #HEIF #images
docs.text:
HEIF stands for High Efficiency Image File Format. It is a modern image format developed to store images more efficiently than traditional formats like JPEG. HEIF files can maintain high image quality while taking up less storage space, often about half the size of equivalent JPEG files.

See also: [[260106112106|How to convert HEIF images on Mac]] [[260106113255|How to change iphone HEIF camera settings]]

docs.title: Why and How to Roast Peanuts
Why and How to Roast Peanuts
docs.text:
Overall, the nutritional differences between roasted and unroasted peanuts are not substantial, and the benefits of roasting in terms of safety and digestibility generally outweigh the minor nutritional losses.

Roasting  peanuts might seem like a simple task, but achieving that perfect balance of flavor and crunch requires a little finesse. It’s a journey of patience and observation, and the reward is a batch of warm, aromatic peanuts that are infinitely more satisfying than anything you can buy in a store.

Proper preparation is crucial for achieving evenly roasted peanuts. Start by thoroughly inspecting the peanuts, discarding any that are discolored, shriveled, or have an off odor.

Roasting peanuts at home is a simple process. Spread the peanuts in a single layer on a baking sheet and roast them in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for 15-20 minutes, or until they are lightly browned and fragrant. Stir them occasionally to ensure even roasting.

docs.title: Tips for Perfect Peanuts
docs.text:
• Don’t overcrowd the baking sheet or skillet. Overcrowding will prevent the peanuts from roasting evenly.
  • Stir or shake the peanuts frequently. This ensures that all sides are exposed to the heat, resulting in a uniform roast.
  • Keep a close eye on the peanuts. They can burn quickly, especially towards the end of the roasting process.
  • Let the peanuts cool completely before storing. This allows them to crisp up fully and prevents them from becoming soggy.
  • Store roasted peanuts in an airtight container at room temperature. They will stay fresh for several weeks.

Proper storage is essential to maintain the quality and flavor of your freshly roasted peanuts. Once cooled, transfer them to an airtight container. Storing them at room temperature is generally sufficient, and they should remain fresh for several weeks.

docs.title: ssg
docs.text:
https://medevel.com/11-search-solutions-for-static-websites/

Pagefinder works with the below workflow:

Add the below code to the layouts files (either in the head or body elements)

https://pagefind.app/docs/ui-usage/

<link href="./pagefind/pagefind-ui.css" rel="stylesheet">
<script src="./pagefind/pagefind-ui.js"></script>

<div id="search"></div>
<script>
window.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', (event) => {
        new PagefindUI({ element: "#search", showSubResults: true });
    });
</script>

Then in VSCode, open the source folder, click on one of the markdown files, click View > Command Pallete to use the Markdown All-in-one-extension > in the window that opens, Select the source folder for the markdown documents > then specify the default Out folder for the HTML files to be created in the default path within the source folder.

Then run Pagefind on the out folder. 

**./pagefind --site <path to out folder>                  

Then move the created index folder (named Pagefind) one level up to the source folder. You can now delete the temporary "Out" folder.

docs.title: What are oats
docs.text: Oats, scientifically known as Avena sativa, are **a whole grain ** that comes in various forms, including rolled oats, quick oats, and steel-cut oats. Oats are high in fiber and rich in anti-oxidants.

docs.title: Making a smoothie
docs.text:
A regular blender can be used to make a smoothie but a specialized smoothie blender has more powerful motors, better blades for crushing nuts, and the shape of the jar draws the blend into the blades for better blending.

The order of ingredients can significantly affect blending. A good rule of thumb is to:

  1. Start with the liquid at the bottom. This helps the blades create a vortex that pulls the solids down.
  2. Add soft ingredients like bananas and yogurt.
  3. Place harder ingredients like frozen fruits and ice at the top. This prevents jamming and allows the blender to process items smoothly.

Using a proper blending technique is essential for achieving the desired texture:

  1. Start Slow: Begin blending at a lower speed. Gradually increase to higher speeds once the mixture starts combining.
  2. Stop and Stir: If necessary, pause the blender and use a spatula to stir the mixture, ensuring everything is evenly blended.
  3. Pulse Feature: If your blender has a pulse option, use it for tough ingredients. This can help break down harder pieces without over-blending.

Always clean your blender immediately after use. Blend warm water with a drop of dish soap for a quick clean. Rinse thoroughly to prevent residue buildup.

docs.title: About Mayonnaise
docs.text:
Mayonnaise is made from oil (soybean oil/olive), eggs, and vinegar. It may also contain salt, sugar, and spices such as mustard powder or paprika. 

The ingredients in mayonnaise are mixed to create an emulsion. This is when ingredients blend together and don’t separate. But if you’ve ever mixed oil and vinegar, you know that they don’t combine well. In mayonnaise, egg yolks are the ingredient that bring it all together. 

Mayonnaise contains some healthful unsaturated fats that can benefit your health. But because mayonnaise is high in both calories and fat, it’s best to use it sparingly.

docs.title: The Benefit of Rotisserie Cooking
docs.text:
Rotisserie cooking creates a crispy exterior while keeping the inside moist and tender. The rotation allows the meat to baste in its own juices, enhancing flavor.

Further, the constant rotation ensures that heat is distributed evenly, preventing hot spots and undercooked areas.

Then, as the meat cooks, excess fat drips away, resulting in a healthier meal with less grease compared to traditional frying or grilling methods.

Lastly, the rotisserie method allows for slow cooking, which can enhance flavors and tenderness without requiring constant attention.

docs.title: What is Ketosis
docs.text:
Ketosis is a process that happens when your body doesn't have enough carbohydrates to burn for energy. Instead, it burns fat and makes things called ketones, which it can use for fuel.

Ketosis usually kicks in after 3 or 4 days of eating fewer than 50 grams of carbohydrates per day. You can start ketosis by fasting, too.

A diet high in fat and protein but very low in carbs is called a ketogenic or "keto" diet.
